element.name: Segment
element.documentation: The `Root Element` that contains all other `Top-Level Elements`; see (#data-layout).

element.name: SeekHead
element.documentation: Contains seeking information of `Top-Level Elements`; see (#data-layout).

element.name: Seek
element.documentation: Contains a single seek entry to an EBML Element.

element.name: SeekID
element.documentation: The binary EBML ID of a `Top-Level Element`.

element.name: SeekPosition
element.documentation: The `Segment Position` ((#segment-position)) of a `Top-Level Element`.

element.name: Info
element.documentation: Contains general information about the `Segment`.

element.name: SegmentUUID
element.documentation: A randomly generated UID that identifies the `Segment` amongst many others (128 bits). It is equivalent to a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) v4 [@!RFC4122] with all bits randomly (or pseudorandomly) chosen. An actual UUID v4 value, where some bits are not random, **MAY** also be used.
If the `Segment` is a part of a `Linked Segment`, then this element is **REQUIRED**. The value of the UID **MUST** contain at least one bit set to 1.

element.name: SegmentFilename
element.documentation: A filename corresponding to this `Segment`.

element.name: PrevUUID
element.documentation: An ID that identifies the previous `Segment` of a `Linked Segment`.

If the `Segment` is a part of a `Linked Segment` that uses Hard Linking ((#hard-linking)), then either the `PrevUUID` or the `NextUUID` element is **REQUIRED**. If a `Segment` contains a `PrevUUID` but not a `NextUUID`, then it **MAY** be considered as the last `Segment` of the `Linked Segment`. The `PrevUUID` **MUST NOT** be equal to the `SegmentUUID`.

element.name: PrevFilename
element.documentation: A filename corresponding to the file of the previous `Linked Segment`.
Provision of the previous filename is for display convenience, but `PrevUUID` **SHOULD** be considered authoritative for identifying the previous `Segment` in a `Linked Segment`.

element.name: NextUUID
element.documentation: An ID that identifies the next `Segment` of a `Linked Segment`.

If the `Segment` is a part of a `Linked Segment` that uses Hard Linking ((#hard-linking)), then either the `PrevUUID` or the `NextUUID` element is **REQUIRED**. If a `Segment` contains a `NextUUID` but not a `PrevUUID`, then it **MAY** be considered as the first `Segment` of the `Linked Segment`. The `NextUUID` **MUST NOT** be equal to the `SegmentUUID`.

element.name: NextFilename
element.documentation: A filename corresponding to the file of the next `Linked Segment`.
Provision of the next filename is for display convenience, but `NextUUID` **SHOULD** be considered authoritative for identifying the Next `Segment`.

element.name: SegmentFamily
element.documentation: A UID that all `Segments` of a `Linked Segment` **MUST** share (128 bits). It is equivalent to a UUID v4 [@!RFC4122] with all bits randomly (or pseudorandomly) chosen. An actual UUID v4 value, where some bits are not random, **MAY** also be used.
If the `Segment` `Info` contains a `ChapterTranslate` element, this element is **REQUIRED**.

element.name: ChapterTranslate
element.documentation: The mapping between this `Segment` and a segment value in the given Chapter Codec.

Chapter Codecs may need to address different segments, but they may not know of the way to identify such segments when stored in Matroska. This element and its child elements add a way to map the internal segments known to the Chapter Codec to the `SegmentUUID`s in Matroska. This allows remuxing a file with Chapter Codec without changing the content of the codec data, just the `Segment` mapping.

element.name: ChapterTranslateID
element.documentation: The binary value used to represent this `Segment` in the chapter codec data. The format depends on the `ChapProcessCodecID` used; see (#chapprocesscodecid-element).

element.name: ChapterTranslateCodec
element.documentation: Applies to the chapter codec of the given chapter edition(s); see (#chapprocesscodecid-element).

element.name: ChapterTranslateEditionUID
element.documentation: Specifies a chapter edition UID to which this `ChapterTranslate` applies.
When no `ChapterTranslateEditionUID` is specified in the `ChapterTranslate`, the `ChapterTranslate` applies to all chapter editions found in the `Segment` using the given `ChapterTranslateCodec`.

element.name: TimestampScale
element.documentation: Base unit for Segment Ticks and Track Ticks, in nanoseconds. A `TimestampScale` value of 1000000 means scaled timestamps in the `Segment` are expressed in milliseconds; see (#timestamps) on how to interpret timestamps.

element.name: Duration
element.documentation: Duration of the `Segment`, expressed in `Segment` Ticks, which are based on `TimestampScale`; see (#timestamp-ticks).

element.name: DateUTC
element.documentation: The date and time that the `Segment` was created by the muxing application or library.

element.name: Title
element.documentation: General name of the `Segment`.

element.name: MuxingApp
element.documentation: Muxing application or library (example: "libmatroska-0.4.3").
Include the full name of the application or library followed by the version number.

element.name: WritingApp
element.documentation: Writing application (example: "mkvmerge-0.3.3").
Include the full name of the application followed by the version number.

element.name: Cluster
element.documentation: The `Top-Level Element` containing the (monolithic) `Block` structure.

element.name: Timestamp
element.documentation: Absolute timestamp of the cluster, expressed in Segment Ticks, which are based on `TimestampScale`; see (#timestamp-ticks).
This element **SHOULD** be the first child element of the `Cluster` it belongs to or the second if that `Cluster` contains a `CRC-32` element ((#crc-32)).

element.name: SilentTracks
element.documentation: The list of tracks that are not used in that part of the stream. It is useful when using overlay tracks for seeking or deciding what track to use.

element.name: SilentTrackNumber
element.documentation: One of the track numbers that is not used from now on in the stream. It could change later if not specified as silent in a further `Cluster`.

element.name: Position
element.documentation: The `Segment Position` of the `Cluster` in the `Segment` (0 in live streams). It might help to resynchronize the offset on damaged streams.

element.name: PrevSize
element.documentation: Size of the previous `Cluster`, in octets. Can be useful for backward playing.

element.name: SimpleBlock
element.documentation: Similar to `Block` (see (#block-structure)) but without all the extra information. Mostly used to reduce overhead when no extra feature is needed; see (#simpleblock-structure) on `SimpleBlock` Structure.

element.name: BlockGroup
element.documentation: Basic container of information containing a single `Block` and information specific to that `Block`.

element.name: Block
element.documentation: `Block` containing the actual data to be rendered and a timestamp relative to the `Cluster` Timestamp; see (#block-structure) on `Block` Structure.

element.name: BlockVirtual
element.documentation: A `Block` with no data. It must be stored in the stream at the place the real `Block` would be in display order.

element.name: BlockAdditions
element.documentation: Contains additional binary data to complete the `Block` element; see [@?I-D.ietf-cellar-codec, section 4.1.5] for more information. An EBML parser that has no knowledge of the `Block` structure could still see and use/skip these data.

element.name: BlockMore
element.documentation: Contains the `BlockAdditional` and some parameters.

element.name: BlockAdditional
element.documentation: Interpreted by the codec as it wishes (using the `BlockAddID`).

element.name: BlockAddID
element.documentation: An ID that identifies how to interpret the `BlockAdditional` data; see [@?I-D.ietf-cellar-codec, section 4.1.5] for more information. A value of 1 indicates that the `BlockAdditional` data is defined by the codec. Any other value indicates that the `BlockAdditional` data should be handled according to the `BlockAddIDType` that is located in the `TrackEntry`.
Each `BlockAddID` value **MUST** be unique between all `BlockMore` elements found in a `BlockAdditions` element. To keep `MaxBlockAdditionID` as low as possible, small values **SHOULD** be used.

element.name: BlockDuration
element.documentation: The duration of the `Block`, expressed in Track Ticks; see (#timestamp-ticks). The `BlockDuration` element can be useful at the end of a `Track` to define the duration of the last frame (as there is no subsequent `Block` available) or when there is a break in a track like for subtitle tracks.
element.implementation_note: `BlockDuration` **MUST** be set (minOccurs=1) if the associated `TrackEntry` stores a `DefaultDuration` value.

If a value is not present and no `DefaultDuration` is defined, the value is assumed to be the difference between the timestamp of this `Block` and the timestamp of the next `Block` in "display" order (not coding order).

element.name: ReferencePriority
element.documentation: This frame is referenced and has the specified cache priority. In the cache, only a frame of the same or higher priority can replace this frame. A value of 0 means the frame is not referenced.

element.name: ReferenceBlock
element.documentation:
A timestamp value, relative to the timestamp of the `Block` in this `BlockGroup`, expressed in Track Ticks; see (#timestamp-ticks). This is used to reference other frames necessary to decode this frame. The relative value **SHOULD** correspond to a valid `Block` that this `Block` depends on. Historically, `Matroska Writers` didn't write the actual `Block(s)` that this `Block` depends on, but they did write *some* `Block(s)` in the past.
The value "0" **MAY** also be used to signify that this `Block` cannot be decoded on its own, but the necessary reference `Block(s)` is unknown. In this case, other `ReferenceBlock` elements **MUST NOT** be found in the same `BlockGroup`.
If the `BlockGroup` doesn't have a `ReferenceBlock` element, then the `Block` it contains can be decoded without using any other `Block` data.

element.name: ReferenceVirtual
element.documentation: The `Segment Position` of the data that would otherwise be in position of the virtual block.

element.name: CodecState
element.documentation: The new codec state to use. Data interpretation is private to the codec. This information **SHOULD** always be referenced by a seek entry.

element.name: DiscardPadding
element.documentation: Duration of the silent data added to the `Block`, expressed in Matroska Ticks -- i.e., in nanoseconds; see (#timestamp-ticks) (padding at the end of the `Block` for positive values and at the beginning of the `Block` for negative values). The duration of `DiscardPadding` is not calculated in the duration of the `TrackEntry` and **SHOULD** be discarded during playback.

element.name: Slices
element.documentation: Contains slices description.

element.name: TimeSlice
element.documentation: Contains extra time information about the data contained in the `Block`. Being able to interpret this element is not required for playback.

element.name: LaceNumber
element.documentation: The reverse number of the frame in the lace (0 is the last frame, 1 is the next to last, etc.). Being able to interpret this element is not required for playback.

element.name: FrameNumber
element.documentation: The number of the frame to generate from this lace with this delay (allows for the generation of many frames from the same Block/Frame).

element.name: BlockAdditionID
element.documentation: The ID of the `BlockAdditional` element (0 is the main `Block`).

element.name: Delay
element.documentation: The delay to apply to the element, expressed in Track Ticks; see (#timestamp-ticks).

element.name: SliceDuration
element.documentation: The duration to apply to the element, expressed in Track Ticks; see (#timestamp-ticks).

element.name: ReferenceFrame
element.documentation: Contains information about the last reference frame. See [@?DivXTrickTrack].

element.name: ReferenceOffset
element.documentation: The relative offset, in bytes, from the previous `BlockGroup` element for this Smooth FF/RW video track to the containing `BlockGroup` element. See [@?DivXTrickTrack].

element.name: ReferenceTimestamp
element.documentation: The timestamp of the `BlockGroup` pointed to by ReferenceOffset, expressed in Track Ticks; see (#timestamp-ticks). See [@?DivXTrickTrack].

element.name: EncryptedBlock
element.documentation: Similar to `SimpleBlock` (see (#simpleblock-structure)), but the data inside the `Block` are Transformed (encrypted and/or signed).

element.name: Tracks
element.documentation: A `Top-Level Element` of information with many tracks described.

element.name: TrackEntry
element.documentation: Describes a track with all elements.

element.name: TrackNumber
element.documentation: The track number as used in the `Block` Header.

element.name: TrackUID
element.documentation: A UID that identifies the `Track`.

element.name: TrackType
element.documentation: The `TrackType` defines the type of each frame found in the `Track`. The value **SHOULD** be stored on 1 octet.

enum.label: video
enum.documentation: An image.

enum.label: audio
enum.documentation: Audio samples.

enum.label: complex
enum.documentation: A mix of different other `TrackType`. The codec needs to define how the `Matroska Player` should interpret such data.

enum.label: logo
enum.documentation: An image to be rendered over the video track(s).

enum.label: subtitle
enum.documentation: Subtitle or closed caption data to be rendered over the video track(s).

enum.label: buttons
enum.documentation: Interactive button(s) to be rendered over the video track(s).

enum.label: control
enum.documentation: Metadata used to control the player of the `Matroska Player`.

enum.label: metadata
enum.documentation: Timed metadata that can be passed on to the `Matroska Player`.

element.name: FlagEnabled
element.documentation: Set to 1 if the track is usable. It is possible to turn a track that is not usable into a usable track using chapter codecs or control tracks.

element.name: FlagDefault
element.documentation: Set to 1 if the track (audio, video, or subtitles) is eligible for automatic selection by the player; see (#default-track-selection) for more details.

element.name: FlagForced
element.documentation: Applies only to subtitles. Set to 1 if the track is eligible for automatic selection by the player if it matches the user's language preference, even if the user's preferences would not normally enable subtitles with the selected audio track; this can be used for tracks containing only translations of audio in foreign languages or on-screen text. See (#default-track-selection) for more details.

element.name: FlagHearingImpaired
element.documentation: Set to 1 if and only if the track is suitable for users with hearing impairments.

element.name: FlagVisualImpaired
element.documentation: Set to 1 if and only if the track is suitable for users with visual impairments.

element.name: FlagTextDescriptions
element.documentation: Set to 1 if and only if the track contains textual descriptions of video content.

element.name: FlagOriginal
element.documentation: Set to 1 if and only if the track is in the content's original language.

element.name: FlagCommentary
element.documentation: Set to 1 if and only if the track contains commentary.

element.name: FlagLacing
element.documentation: Set to 1 if the track **MAY** contain blocks that use lacing. When set to 0, all blocks **MUST** have their lacing flags set to "no lacing"; see (#block-lacing) on 'Block' Lacing.

element.name: MinCache
element.documentation: The minimum number of frames a player should be able to cache during playback. If set to 0, the reference pseudo-cache system is not used.

element.name: MaxCache
element.documentation: The maximum cache size necessary to store referenced frames in and the current frame. 0 means no cache is needed.

element.name: DefaultDuration
element.documentation: Number of nanoseconds per frame, expressed in Matroska Ticks -- i.e., in nanoseconds; see (#timestamp-ticks) ("frame" in the Matroska sense -- one element put into a (Simple)Block).

element.name: DefaultDecodedFieldDuration
element.documentation: The period between two successive fields at the output of the decoding process, expressed in Matroska Ticks -- i.e., in nanoseconds; see (#timestamp-ticks). See (#defaultdecodedfieldduration) for more information.

element.name: TrackTimestampScale
element.documentation: The scale to apply on this track to work at normal speed in relation with other tracks (mostly used to adjust video speed when the audio length differs).

element.name: TrackOffset
element.documentation: A value to add to the `Block`'s Timestamp, expressed in Matroska Ticks -- i.e., in nanoseconds; see (#timestamp-ticks). This can be used to adjust the playback offset of a track.

element.name: MaxBlockAdditionID
element.documentation: The maximum value of `BlockAddID` ((#blockaddid-element)). A value of 0 means there is no `BlockAdditions` ((#blockadditions-element)) for this track.

element.name: BlockAdditionMapping
element.documentation: Contains elements that extend the track format by adding content either to each frame, with `BlockAddID` ((#blockaddid-element)), or to the track as a whole with `BlockAddIDExtraData`.

element.name: BlockAddIDValue
element.documentation: If the track format extension needs content beside frames, the value refers to the `BlockAddID` ((#blockaddid-element)) value being described.
To keep `MaxBlockAdditionID` as low as possible, small values **SHOULD** be used.

element.name: BlockAddIDName
element.documentation: A human-friendly name describing the type of `BlockAdditional` data, as defined by the associated `Block Additional Mapping`.

element.name: BlockAddIDType
element.documentation: Stores the registered identifier of the `Block Additional Mapping` to define how the `BlockAdditional` data should be handled.
If `BlockAddIDType` is 0, the `BlockAddIDValue` and corresponding `BlockAddID` values **MUST** be 1.

element.name: BlockAddIDExtraData
element.documentation: Extra binary data that the `BlockAddIDType` can use to interpret the `BlockAdditional` data. The interpretation of the binary data depends on the `BlockAddIDType` value and the corresponding `Block Additional Mapping`.

element.name: Name
element.documentation: A human-readable track name.

element.name: Language
element.documentation: The language of the track, in the Matroska languages form; see (#language-codes) on language codes. This element **MUST** be ignored if the `LanguageBCP47` element is used in the same `TrackEntry`.

element.name: LanguageBCP47
element.documentation: The language of the track, in the form defined in [@!RFC5646]; see (#language-codes) on language codes. If this element is used, then any `Language` elements used in the same `TrackEntry` **MUST** be ignored.

element.name: CodecID
element.documentation: An ID corresponding to the codec; see [@?I-D.ietf-cellar-codec] for more info.

element.name: CodecPrivate
element.documentation: Private data only known to the codec.

element.name: CodecName
element.documentation: A human-readable string specifying the codec.

element.name: AttachmentLink
element.documentation: The UID of an attachment that is used by this codec.
The value **MUST** match the `FileUID` value of an attachment found in this `Segment`.

element.name: CodecSettings
element.documentation: A string describing the encoding setting used.

element.name: CodecInfoURL
element.documentation: A URL to find information about the codec used.

element.name: CodecDownloadURL
element.documentation: A URL to download information about the codec used.

element.name: CodecDecodeAll
element.documentation: Set to 1 if the codec can decode potentially damaged data.

element.name: TrackOverlay
element.documentation: Specify that this track is an overlay track for the `Track` specified (in the u-integer). This means that when this track has a gap on `SilentTracks`, the overlay track should be used instead. The order of multiple `TrackOverlay` matters; the first one is the one that should be used. If the first one is not found, it should be the second, etc.

element.name: CodecDelay
element.documentation: The built-in delay for the codec, expressed in Matroska Ticks -- i.e., in nanoseconds; see (#timestamp-ticks). It represents the number of codec samples that will be discarded by the decoder during playback. This timestamp value **MUST** be subtracted from each frame timestamp in order to get the timestamp that will be actually played. The value **SHOULD** be small so the muxing of tracks with the same actual timestamp are in the same `Cluster`.

element.name: SeekPreRoll
element.documentation: After a discontinuity, the duration of the data that the decoder **MUST** decode before the decoded data is valid, expressed in Matroska Ticks -- i.e., in nanoseconds; see (#timestamp-ticks).

element.name: TrackTranslate
element.documentation: The mapping between this `TrackEntry` and a track value in the given Chapter Codec.

Chapter Codecs may need to address content in a specific track, but they may not know of the way to identify tracks in Matroska. This element and its child elements add a way to map the internal tracks known to the Chapter Codec to the track IDs in Matroska. This allows remuxing a file with Chapter Codec without changing the content of the codec data, just the track mapping.

element.name: TrackTranslateTrackID
element.documentation: The binary value used to represent this `TrackEntry` in the chapter codec data. The format depends on the `ChapProcessCodecID` used; see (#chapprocesscodecid-element).

element.name: TrackTranslateCodec
element.documentation: Applies to the chapter codec of the given chapter edition(s); see (#chapprocesscodecid-element).

element.name: TrackTranslateEditionUID
element.documentation: Specifies a chapter edition UID to which this `TrackTranslate` applies.
When no `TrackTranslateEditionUID` is specified in the `TrackTranslate`, the `TrackTranslate` applies to all chapter editions found in the `Segment` using the given `TrackTranslateCodec`.

element.name: Video
element.documentation: Video settings.

element.name: FlagInterlaced
element.documentation: Specifies whether the video frames in this track are interlaced.

enum.label: undetermined
enum.documentation: Unknown status.
This value **SHOULD** be avoided.

enum.label: interlaced
enum.documentation: Interlaced frames.

enum.label: progressive
enum.documentation: No interlacing.

element.name: FieldOrder
element.documentation: Specifies the field ordering of video frames in this track.
If `FlagInterlaced` is not set to 1, this element **MUST** be ignored.

enum.label: progressive
enum.documentation: Interlaced frames.
This value **SHOULD** be avoided; setting `FlagInterlaced` to 2 is sufficient.

enum.label: tff
enum.documentation: Top field displayed first. Top field stored first.

enum.label: undetermined
enum.documentation: Unknown field order.
This value **SHOULD** be avoided.

enum.label: bff
enum.documentation: Bottom field displayed first. Bottom field stored first.

enum.label: tff (interleaved)
enum.documentation: Top field displayed first. Fields are interleaved in storage with the top line of the top field stored first.

enum.label: bff (interleaved)
enum.documentation: Bottom field displayed first. Fields are interleaved in storage with the top line of the top field stored first.

element.name: StereoMode
element.documentation: Stereo-3D video mode. See (#multi-planar-and-3d-videos) for more details.

enum.label: both eyes laced in one Block (left eye is first)
both eyes laced in one Block (right eye is first)

element.name: AlphaMode
element.documentation: Indicates whether the `BlockAdditional` element with `BlockAddID` of "1" contains Alpha data as defined by the Codec Mapping for the `CodecID`. Undefined values (i.e., values other than 0 or 1) **SHOULD NOT** be used, as the behavior of known implementations is different.

enum.label: none
enum.documentation: The `BlockAdditional` element with `BlockAddID` of "1" does not exist or **SHOULD NOT** be considered as containing such data.

enum.label: present
enum.documentation: The `BlockAdditional` element with `BlockAddID` of "1" contains alpha channel data.

element.name: OldStereoMode
element.documentation: Bogus `StereoMode` value used in old versions of [@?libmatroska].
This element **MUST NOT** be used. It was an incorrect value used in libmatroska up to 0.9.0.

element.name: PixelWidth
element.documentation: Width of the encoded video frames in pixels.

element.name: PixelHeight
element.documentation: Height of the encoded video frames in pixels.

element.name: PixelCropBottom
element.documentation: The number of video pixels to remove at the bottom of the image.

element.name: PixelCropTop
element.documentation: The number of video pixels to remove at the top of the image.

element.name: PixelCropLeft
element.documentation: The number of video pixels to remove on the left of the image.

element.name: PixelCropRight
element.documentation: The number of video pixels to remove on the right of the image.

element.name: DisplayWidth
element.documentation: Width of the video frames to display. Applies to the video frame after cropping (PixelCrop* Elements).
element.implementation_note: If the DisplayUnit of the same `TrackEntry` is 0, then the default value for `DisplayWidth` is equal to `PixelWidth` - `PixelCropLeft` - `PixelCropRight`; else, there is no default value.

element.name: DisplayHeight
element.documentation: Height of the video frames to display. Applies to the video frame after cropping (PixelCrop* Elements).
element.implementation_note: If the DisplayUnit of the same `TrackEntry` is 0, then the default value for `DisplayHeight` is equal to `PixelHeight` - `PixelCropTop` - `PixelCropBottom`; else, there is no default value.

element.name: DisplayUnit
element.documentation: How `DisplayWidth` and `DisplayHeight` are interpreted.

element.name: AspectRatioType
element.documentation: Specifies the possible modifications to the aspect ratio.

element.name: UncompressedFourCC
element.documentation: Specifies the uncompressed pixel format used for the `Track`'s data as a FourCC. This value is similar in scope to the biCompression value of AVI's `BITMAPINFO` [@?AVIFormat]. There is neither a definitive list of FourCC values nor an official registry. Some common values for YUV pixel formats can be found at [@?MSYUV8], [@?MSYUV16], and [@?FourCC-YUV]. Some common values for uncompressed RGB pixel formats can be found at [@?MSRGB] and [@?FourCC-RGB].
element.implementation_note: UncompressedFourCC **MUST** be set (minOccurs=1) in `TrackEntry` when the `CodecID` element of the `TrackEntry` is set to "V_UNCOMPRESSED".

element.name: GammaValue
element.documentation: Gamma value.

element.name: FrameRate
element.documentation: Number of frames per second. This value is informational only. It is intended for constant frame rate streams and should not be used for a variable frame rate `TrackEntry`.

element.name: Colour
element.documentation: Settings describing the color format.

element.name: MatrixCoefficients
element.documentation: The Matrix Coefficients of the video used to derive luma and chroma values from red, green, and blue color primaries. For clarity, the value and meanings for `MatrixCoefficients` are adopted from Table 4 of [@!ITU-H.273].

element.name: BitsPerChannel
element.documentation: Number of decoded bits per channel. A value of 0 indicates that the `BitsPerChannel` is unspecified.

element.name: ChromaSubsamplingHorz
element.documentation: The number of pixels to remove in the Cr and Cb channels for every pixel not removed horizontally. Example: For video with 4:2:0 chroma subsampling, the `ChromaSubsamplingHorz` **SHOULD** be set to 1.

element.name: ChromaSubsamplingVert
element.documentation: The number of pixels to remove in the Cr and Cb channels for every pixel not removed vertically. Example: For video with 4:2:0 chroma subsampling, the `ChromaSubsamplingVert` **SHOULD** be set to 1.

element.name: CbSubsamplingHorz
element.documentation: The number of pixels to remove in the Cb channel for every pixel not removed horizontally. This is additive with `ChromaSubsamplingHorz`. Example: For video with 4:2:1 chroma subsampling, the `ChromaSubsamplingHorz` **SHOULD** be set to 1, and `CbSubsamplingHorz` **SHOULD** be set to 1.

element.name: CbSubsamplingVert
element.documentation: The number of pixels to remove in the Cb channel for every pixel not removed vertically. This is additive with `ChromaSubsamplingVert`.

element.name: ChromaSitingHorz
element.documentation: How chroma is subsampled horizontally.

element.name: ChromaSitingVert
element.documentation: How chroma is subsampled vertically.

element.name: Range
element.documentation: Clipping of the color ranges.

element.name: TransferCharacteristics
element.documentation: The transfer characteristics of the video. For clarity, the value and meanings for `TransferCharacteristics` are adopted from Table 3 of [@!ITU-H.273].

element.name: Primaries
element.documentation: The color primaries of the video. For clarity, the value and meanings for `Primaries` are adopted from Table 2 of [@!ITU-H.273].

element.name: MaxCLL
element.documentation: Maximum brightness of a single pixel (Maximum Content Light Level) in candelas per square meter (cd/m^2^).

element.name: MaxFALL
element.documentation: Maximum brightness of a single full frame (Maximum Frame-Average Light Level) in candelas per square meter (cd/m^2^).

element.name: MasteringMetadata
element.documentation: SMPTE 2086 mastering data.

element.name: PrimaryRChromaticityX
element.documentation: Red X chromaticity coordinate, as defined by [@!CIE-1931].

element.name: PrimaryRChromaticityY
element.documentation: Red Y chromaticity coordinate, as defined by [@!CIE-1931].

element.name: PrimaryGChromaticityX
element.documentation: Green X chromaticity coordinate, as defined by [@!CIE-1931].

element.name: PrimaryGChromaticityY
element.documentation: Green Y chromaticity coordinate, as defined by [@!CIE-1931].

element.name: PrimaryBChromaticityX
element.documentation: Blue X chromaticity coordinate, as defined by [@!CIE-1931].

element.name: PrimaryBChromaticityY
element.documentation: Blue Y chromaticity coordinate, as defined by [@!CIE-1931].

element.name: WhitePointChromaticityX
element.documentation: White X chromaticity coordinate, as defined by [@!CIE-1931].

element.name: WhitePointChromaticityY
element.documentation: White Y chromaticity coordinate, as defined by [@!CIE-1931].

element.name: LuminanceMax
element.documentation: Maximum luminance. Represented in candelas per square meter (cd/m^2^).

element.name: LuminanceMin
element.documentation: Minimum luminance. Represented in candelas per square meter (cd/m^2^).

element.name: Projection
element.documentation: Describes the video projection details. Used to render spherical or VR videos or to flip videos horizontally or vertically.

element.name: ProjectionType
element.documentation: Describes the projection used for this video track.

element.name: ProjectionPrivate
element.documentation: Private data that only applies to a specific projection. * If `ProjectionType` equals 0 (rectangular), then this element **MUST NOT** be present. * If `ProjectionType` equals 1 (equirectangular), then this element **MUST** be present and contain the same binary data that would be stored inside an ISOBMFF Equirectangular Projection Box ("equi"). * If `ProjectionType` equals 2 (cubemap), then this element **MUST** be present and contain the same binary data that would be stored inside an ISOBMFF Cubemap Projection Box ("cbmp"). * If `ProjectionType` equals 3 (mesh), then this element **MUST** be present and contain the same binary data that would be stored inside an ISOBMFF Mesh Projection Box ("mshp").

ISOBMFF box size and FourCC fields are not included in the binary data, but the FullBox version and flag fields are. This is to avoid redundant framing information while preserving versioning and semantics between the two container formats.

element.name: ProjectionPoseYaw
element.documentation:
Specifies a yaw rotation to the projection.
Value represents a clockwise rotation, in degrees, around the up vector. This rotation must be applied before any `ProjectionPosePitch` or `ProjectionPoseRoll` rotations. The value of this element **MUST** be in the -180 to 180 degree range, both inclusive.
Setting `ProjectionPoseYaw` to 180 or -180 degrees with `ProjectionPoseRoll` and `ProjectionPosePitch` set to 0 degrees flips the image horizontally.

element.name: ProjectionPosePitch
element.documentation:
Specifies a pitch rotation to the projection.
Value represents a counter-clockwise rotation, in degrees, around the right vector. This rotation must be applied after the `ProjectionPoseYaw` rotation and before the `ProjectionPoseRoll` rotation. The value of this element **MUST** be in the -90 to 90 degree range, both inclusive.

element.name: ProjectionPoseRoll
element.documentation:
Specifies a roll rotation to the projection.
Value represents a counter-clockwise rotation, in degrees, around the forward vector. This rotation must be applied after the `ProjectionPoseYaw` and `ProjectionPosePitch` rotations. The value of this element **MUST** be in the -180 to 180 degree range, both inclusive.
Setting `ProjectionPoseRoll` to 180 or -180 degrees and `ProjectionPoseYaw` to 180 or -180 degrees with `ProjectionPosePitch` set to 0 degrees flips the image vertically.
Setting `ProjectionPoseRoll` to 180 or -180 degrees with `ProjectionPoseYaw` and `ProjectionPosePitch` set to 0 degrees flips the image horizontally and vertically.

element.name: Audio
element.documentation: Audio settings.

element.name: SamplingFrequency
element.documentation: Sampling frequency in Hz.

element.name: OutputSamplingFrequency
element.documentation: Real output sampling frequency in Hz that is used for Spectral Band Replication (SBR) techniques.
element.implementation_note: The default value for `OutputSamplingFrequency` of the same `TrackEntry` is equal to the `SamplingFrequency`.

element.name: Channels
element.documentation: Numbers of channels in the track.

element.name: ChannelPositions
element.documentation: Table of horizontal angles for each successive channel.

element.name: BitDepth
element.documentation: Bits per sample, mostly used for PCM.

element.name: Emphasis
element.documentation: Audio emphasis applied on audio samples. The player **MUST** apply the inverse emphasis to get the proper audio samples.

enum.label: CD audio
enum.documentation: First order filter with zero point at 50 microseconds and a pole at 15 microseconds. Also found on DVD Audio and MPEG audio.

enum.label: CCIT J.17
enum.documentation: Defined in [@!ITU-J.17].

enum.label: FM 50
enum.documentation: FM Radio in Europe. RC Filter with a time constant of 50 microseconds.

enum.label: FM 75
enum.documentation: FM Radio in the USA. RC Filter with a time constant of 75 microseconds.

enum.label: Phono RIAA
enum.documentation: Phono filter with time constants of t1=3180, t2=318 and t3=75 microseconds. [@!NAB1964]

enum.label: Phono IEC N78
enum.documentation: Phono filter with time constants of t1=3180, t2=450 and t3=50 microseconds.

enum.label: Phono TELDEC
enum.documentation: Phono filter with time constants of t1=3180, t2=318 and t3=50 microseconds.

enum.label: Phono EMI
enum.documentation: Phono filter with time constants of t1=2500, t2=500 and t3=70 microseconds.

enum.label: Phono Columbia LP
enum.documentation: Phono filter with time constants of t1=1590, t2=318 and t3=100 microseconds.

enum.label: Phono LONDON
enum.documentation: Phono filter with time constants of t1=1590, t2=318 and t3=50 microseconds.

enum.label: Phono NARTB
enum.documentation: Phono filter with time constants of t1=3180, t2=318 and t3=100 microseconds.

element.name: TrackOperation
element.documentation: Operation that needs to be applied on tracks to create this virtual track. For more details, see (#track-operation).

element.name: TrackCombinePlanes
element.documentation: Contains the list of all video plane tracks that need to be combined to create this 3D track.

element.name: TrackPlane
element.documentation: Contains a video plane track that needs to be combined to create this 3D track.

element.name: TrackPlaneUID
element.documentation: The `TrackUID` number of the track representing the plane.

element.name: TrackPlaneType
element.documentation: The kind of plane this track corresponds to.

element.name: TrackJoinBlocks
element.documentation: Contains the list of all tracks whose `Blocks` need to be combined to create this virtual track.

element.name: TrackJoinUID
element.documentation: The `TrackUID` number of a track whose blocks are used to create this virtual track.

element.name: TrickTrackUID
element.documentation: The `TrackUID` of the Smooth FF/RW video in the paired EBML structure corresponding to this video track. See [@?DivXTrickTrack].

element.name: TrickTrackSegmentUID
element.documentation: The `SegmentUUID` of the `Segment` containing the track identified by TrickTrackUID. See [@?DivXTrickTrack].

element.name: TrickTrackFlag
element.documentation: Set to 1 if this video track is a Smooth FF/RW track. If set to 1, `MasterTrackUID` and `MasterTrackSegUID` should be present, and `BlockGroups` for this track must contain ReferenceFrame structures. Otherwise, TrickTrackUID and TrickTrackSegUID must be present if this track has a corresponding Smooth FF/RW track. See [@?DivXTrickTrack].

element.name: TrickMasterTrackUID
element.documentation: The `TrackUID` of the video track in the paired EBML structure that corresponds to this Smooth FF/RW track. See [@?DivXTrickTrack].

element.name: TrickMasterTrackSegmentUID
element.documentation: The `SegmentUUID` of the `Segment` containing the track identified by MasterTrackUID. See [@?DivXTrickTrack].

element.name: ContentEncodings
element.documentation: Settings for several content encoding mechanisms like compression or encryption.

element.name: ContentEncoding
element.documentation: Settings for one content encoding like compression or encryption.

element.name: ContentEncodingOrder
element.documentation: Defines the order to apply each `ContentEncoding` of the `ContentEncodings`. The decoder/demuxer **MUST** start with the `ContentEncoding` with the highest `ContentEncodingOrder` and work its way down to the `ContentEncoding` with the lowest `ContentEncodingOrder`. This value **MUST** be unique for each `ContentEncoding` found in the `ContentEncodings` of this `TrackEntry`.

element.name: ContentEncodingScope
element.documentation: A bit field that describes which elements have been modified in this way. Values (big-endian) can be OR'ed.

enum.label: Block
enum.documentation: All frame contents, excluding lacing data.

enum.label: Private
enum.documentation: The track's `CodecPrivate` data.

enum.label: Next
enum.documentation: The next ContentEncoding (next `ContentEncodingOrder`; the data inside `ContentCompression` and/or `ContentEncryption`).
This value **SHOULD NOT** be used, as it's not supported by players.

element.name: ContentEncodingType
element.documentation: A value describing the kind of transformation that is applied.

element.name: ContentCompression
element.documentation: Settings describing the compression used. This element **MUST** be present if the value of `ContentEncodingType` is 0 and absent otherwise. Each block **MUST** be decompressable, even if no previous block is available in order to not prevent seeking.

element.name: ContentCompAlgo
element.documentation: The compression algorithm used.

Compression method "1" (bzlib) and "2" (lzo1x) lack proper documentation on the format, which limits implementation possibilities. Due to licensing conflicts on commonly available libraries' compression methods, "2" (lzo1x) does not offer widespread interoperability. A `Matroska Writer` **SHOULD NOT** use these compression methods by default. A `Matroska Reader` **MAY** support methods "1" and "2" and **SHOULD** support other methods.

enum.label: zlib
enum.documentation: zlib compression [@!RFC1950].

enum.label: bzlib
enum.documentation: bzip2 compression [@?BZIP2] **SHOULD NOT** be used; see usage notes.

enum.label: lzo1x
enum.documentation: Lempel-Ziv-Oberhumer compression [@?LZO] **SHOULD NOT** be used; see usage notes.

enum.label: Header Stripping
enum.documentation: Octets in `ContentCompSettings` ((#contentcompsettings-element)) have been stripped from each frame.

element.name: ContentCompSettings
element.documentation: Settings that might be needed by the decompressor. For Header Stripping (`ContentCompAlgo`=3), the bytes that were removed from the beginning of each frame of the track.

element.name: ContentEncryption
element.documentation: Settings describing the encryption used. This element **MUST** be present if the value of `ContentEncodingType` is 1 (encryption) and **MUST** be ignored otherwise. A `Matroska Player` **MAY** support encryption.

element.name: ContentEncAlgo
element.documentation: The encryption algorithm used.

enum.label: Not encrypted
enum.documentation: The data are not encrypted.

enum.label: DES
enum.documentation: Data Encryption Standard (DES) [@?FIPS46-3].
This value **SHOULD** be avoided.

enum.label: 3DES
enum.documentation: Triple Data Encryption Algorithm [@?SP800-67].
This value **SHOULD** be avoided.

enum.label: Twofish
enum.documentation: Twofish Encryption Algorithm [@?Twofish].

enum.label: Blowfish
enum.documentation: Blowfish Encryption Algorithm [@?Blowfish].
This value **SHOULD** be avoided.

enum.label: AES
enum.documentation: Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) [@?FIPS197].

element.name: ContentEncKeyID
element.documentation: For public key algorithms, the ID of the public key that the data was encrypted with.

element.name: ContentEncAESSettings
element.documentation: Settings describing the encryption algorithm used.
element.implementation_note: ContentEncAESSettings **MUST NOT** be set (maxOccurs=0) if ContentEncAlgo is not AES (5).

element.name: AESSettingsCipherMode
element.documentation: The AES cipher mode used in the encryption.
element.implementation_note: AESSettingsCipherMode **MUST NOT** be set (maxOccurs=0) if ContentEncAlgo is not AES (5).

enum.label: AES-CTR
enum.documentation: Counter [@?SP800-38A]

enum.label: AES-CBC
enum.documentation: Cipher Block Chaining [@?SP800-38A]

element.name: ContentSignature
element.documentation: A cryptographic signature of the contents.

element.name: ContentSigKeyID
element.documentation: This is the ID of the private key that the data was signed with.

element.name: ContentSigAlgo
element.documentation: The algorithm used for the signature.

element.name: ContentSigHashAlgo
element.documentation: The hash algorithm used for the signature.

element.name: Cues
element.documentation: A `Top-Level Element` to speed seeking access. All entries are local to the `Segment`.
element.implementation_note: This element **SHOULD** be set when the `Segment` is not transmitted as a live stream; see (#livestreaming).

element.name: CuePoint
element.documentation: Contains all information relative to a seek point in the `Segment`.

element.name: CueTime
element.documentation: Absolute timestamp of the seek point, expressed in Segment Ticks, which are based on `TimestampScale`; see (#timestamp-ticks).

element.name: CueTrackPositions
element.documentation: Contains positions for different tracks corresponding to the timestamp.

element.name: CueTrack
element.documentation: The track for which a position is given.

element.name: CueClusterPosition
element.documentation: The `Segment Position` ((#segment-position)) of the `Cluster` containing the associated `Block`.

element.name: CueRelativePosition
element.documentation: The relative position inside the `Cluster` of the referenced `SimpleBlock` or `BlockGroup` with 0 being the first possible position for an element inside that `Cluster`.

element.name: CueDuration
element.documentation: The duration of the block, expressed in Segment Ticks, which are based on `TimestampScale`; see (#timestamp-ticks). If missing, the track's `DefaultDuration` does not apply and no duration information is available in terms of the cues.

element.name: CueBlockNumber
element.documentation: Number of the `Block` in the specified `Cluster`.

element.name: CueCodecState
element.documentation: The `Segment Position` ((#segment-position)) of the Codec State corresponding to this `Cues` element. 0 means that the data is taken from the initial `TrackEntry`.

element.name: CueReference
element.documentation: The `Clusters` containing the referenced `Blocks`.

element.name: CueRefTime
element.documentation: Timestamp of the referenced `Block`, expressed in Segment Ticks which is based on `TimestampScale`; see (#timestamp-ticks).

element.name: CueRefCluster
element.documentation: The `Segment Position` of the `Cluster` containing the referenced `Block`.

element.name: CueRefNumber
element.documentation: Number of the referenced `Block` of Track X in the specified `Cluster`.

element.name: CueRefCodecState
element.documentation: The `Segment Position` of the Codec State corresponding to this referenced element. 0 means that the data is taken from the initial `TrackEntry`.

element.name: Attachments
element.documentation: Contains attached files.

element.name: AttachedFile
element.documentation: An attached file.

element.name: FileDescription
element.documentation: A human-friendly name for the attached file.

element.name: FileName
element.documentation: Filename of the attached file.

element.name: FileMediaType
element.documentation: Media type of the file following the format described in [@!RFC6838].

element.name: FileData
element.documentation: The data of the file.

element.name: FileUID
element.documentation: UID representing the file, as random as possible.

element.name: FileReferral
element.documentation: A binary value that a track/codec can refer to when the attachment is needed.

element.name: FileUsedStartTime
element.documentation: The timestamp at which this optimized font attachment comes into context, expressed in Segment Ticks, which are based on `TimestampScale`. See [@?DivXWorldFonts].
This element is reserved for future use and if written **MUST** be the segment start timestamp.

element.name: FileUsedEndTime
element.documentation: The timestamp at which this optimized font attachment goes out of context, expressed in Segment Ticks, which are based on `TimestampScale`. See [@?DivXWorldFonts].
This element is reserved for future use and if written **MUST** be the segment end timestamp.

element.name: Chapters
element.documentation: A system to define basic menus and partition data. For more detailed information, see (#chapters).

element.name: EditionEntry
element.documentation: Contains all information about a `Segment` edition.

element.name: EditionUID
element.documentation: A UID that identifies the edition. It's useful for tagging an edition.

element.name: EditionFlagHidden
element.documentation: Set to 1 if an edition is hidden. Hidden editions **SHOULD NOT** be available to the user interface (but still be available to Control Tracks; see (#chapter-flags) on `Chapter` flags).

element.name: EditionFlagDefault
element.documentation: Set to 1 if the edition **SHOULD** be used as the default one.

element.name: EditionFlagOrdered
element.documentation: Set to 1 if the chapters can be defined multiple times and the order to play them is enforced; see (#editionflagordered).

element.name: EditionDisplay
element.documentation: Contains a possible string to use for the edition display for the given languages.

element.name: EditionString
element.documentation: Contains the string to use as the edition name.

element.name: EditionLanguageIETF
element.documentation: One language corresponding to the EditionString, in the form defined in [@!RFC5646]; see (#language-codes) on language codes.

element.name: ChapterAtom
element.documentation: Contains the atom information to use as the chapter atom (applies to all tracks).

element.name: ChapterUID
element.documentation: A UID that identifies the `Chapter`.

element.name: ChapterStringUID
element.documentation: A unique string ID that identifies the `Chapter`. For example, it is used as the storage for cue identifier values [@?WebVTT].

element.name: ChapterTimeStart
element.documentation: Timestamp of the start of `Chapter`, expressed in Matroska Ticks -- i.e., in nanoseconds; see (#timestamp-ticks).

element.name: ChapterTimeEnd
element.documentation: Timestamp of the end of `Chapter` (timestamp excluded), expressed in Matroska Ticks -- i.e., in nanoseconds; see (#timestamp-ticks). The value **MUST** be greater than or equal to the `ChapterTimeStart` of the same `ChapterAtom`.

With the `ChapterTimeEnd` timestamp value being excluded, it **MUST** take into account the duration of the last frame it includes, especially for the `ChapterAtom` using the last frames of the `Segment`.
element.implementation_note: ChapterTimeEnd **MUST** be set (minOccurs=1) if the `Edition` is an ordered edition; see (#editionflagordered). If it's a `Parent Chapter`, see (#nested-chapters).

element.name: ChapterFlagHidden
element.documentation: Set to 1 if a chapter is hidden. Hidden chapters **SHOULD NOT** be available to the user interface (but still be available to Control Tracks; see (#chapterflaghidden) on `Chapter` flags).

element.name: ChapterFlagEnabled
element.documentation: Set to 1 if the chapter is enabled. It can be enabled/disabled by a Control Track. When disabled, the movie **SHOULD** skip all the content between the TimeStart and TimeEnd of this chapter; see (#chapter-flags) on `Chapter` flags.

element.name: ChapterSegmentUUID
element.documentation: The `SegmentUUID` of another `Segment` to play during this chapter.
The value **MUST NOT** be the `SegmentUUID` value of the `Segment` it belongs to.
element.implementation_note: `ChapterSegmentUUID` **MUST** be set (minOccurs=1) if `ChapterSegmentEditionUID` is used; see (#medium-linking) on Medium-Linking `Segments`.

element.name: ChapterSkipType
element.documentation: Indicates what type of content the `ChapterAtom` contains and might be skipped. It can be used to automatically skip content based on the type. If a `ChapterAtom` is inside a `ChapterAtom` that has a `ChapterSkipType` set, it **MUST NOT** have a `ChapterSkipType` or have a `ChapterSkipType` with the same value as it's parent `ChapterAtom`. If the `ChapterAtom` doesn't contain a `ChapterTimeEnd`, the value of the `ChapterSkipType` is only valid until the next `ChapterAtom` with a `ChapterSkipType` value or the end of the file.

enum.label: No Skipping
enum.documentation: Content which should not be skipped.

enum.label: Opening Credits
enum.documentation: Credits usually found at the beginning of the content.

enum.label: End Credits
enum.documentation: Credits usually found at the end of the content.

enum.label: Recap
enum.documentation: Recap of previous episodes of the content, usually found around the beginning.

enum.label: Next Preview
enum.documentation: Preview of the next episode of the content, usually found around the end. It may contain spoilers the user wants to avoid.

enum.label: Preview
enum.documentation: Preview of the current episode of the content, usually found around the beginning. It may contain spoilers the user want to avoid.

enum.label: Advertisement
enum.documentation: Advertisement within the content.

element.name: ChapterSegmentEditionUID
element.documentation: The `EditionUID` to play from the `Segment` linked in `ChapterSegmentUUID`. If `ChapterSegmentEditionUID` is undeclared, then no `Edition` of the `Linked Segment` is used; see (#medium-linking) on Medium-Linking `Segments`.

element.name: ChapterPhysicalEquiv
element.documentation: Specifies the physical equivalent of this `ChapterAtom`, e.g., "DVD" (60) or "SIDE" (50); see (#physical-types) for a complete list of values.

element.name: ChapterTrack
element.documentation: List of tracks on which the chapter applies. If this element is not present, all tracks apply.

element.name: ChapterTrackUID
element.documentation: UID of the `Track` to apply this chapter to. In the absence of a control track, choosing this chapter will select the listed `Tracks` and deselect unlisted tracks. Absence of this element indicates that the `Chapter` **SHOULD** be applied to any currently used `Tracks`.

element.name: ChapterDisplay
element.documentation: Contains all possible strings to use for the chapter display.

element.name: ChapString
element.documentation: Contains the string to use as the chapter atom.

element.name: ChapLanguage
element.documentation: A language corresponding to the string, in the Matroska languages form; see (#language-codes) on language codes. This element **MUST** be ignored if a `ChapLanguageBCP47` element is used within the same `ChapterDisplay` element.

element.name: ChapLanguageBCP47
element.documentation: A language corresponding to the `ChapString`, in the form defined in [@!RFC5646]; see (#language-codes) on language codes. If a `ChapLanguageBCP47` element is used, then any `ChapLanguage` and `ChapCountry` elements used in the same `ChapterDisplay` **MUST** be ignored.

element.name: ChapCountry
element.documentation: A country corresponding to the string, in the Matroska countries form; see (#country-codes) on country codes. This element **MUST** be ignored if a `ChapLanguageBCP47` element is used within the same `ChapterDisplay` element.

element.name: ChapProcess
element.documentation: Contains all the commands associated with the Atom.

element.name: ChapProcessCodecID
element.documentation: Contains the type of the codec used for processing.

enum.label: Matroska Script
enum.documentation: Chapter commands using the Matroska Script codec.

enum.label: DVD-menu
enum.documentation: Chapter commands using the DVD-like codec.

element.name: ChapProcessPrivate
element.documentation: Optional data attached to the `ChapProcessCodecID` information. For `ChapProcessCodecID` = 1, it is the "DVD level" equivalent; see (#menu-features) on DVD menus.

element.name: ChapProcessCommand
element.documentation: Contains all the commands associated with the Atom.

element.name: ChapProcessTime
element.documentation: Defines when the process command **SHOULD** be handled.

element.name: ChapProcessData
element.documentation: Contains the command information. The data **SHOULD** be interpreted depending on the `ChapProcessCodecID` value. For `ChapProcessCodecID` = 1, the data correspond to the binary DVD cell pre/post commands; see (#menu-features) on DVD menus.

element.name: Tags
element.documentation: Element containing metadata describing `Tracks`, `Editions`, `Chapters`, `Attachments`, or the `Segment` as a whole. A list of valid tags can be found in [@?I-D.ietf-cellar-tags].

element.name: Tag
element.documentation: A single metadata descriptor.

element.name: Targets
element.documentation: Specifies which other elements the metadata represented by the tag value applies to. If empty or omitted, then the tag value describes everything in the `Segment`.

element.name: TargetTypeValue
element.documentation: A number to indicate the logical level of the target.
The `TargetTypeValue` values are meant to be compared. Higher values **MUST** correspond to a logical level that contains the lower logical level `TargetTypeValue` values.

enum.label: SHOT
enum.documentation: The lowest hierarchy found in music or movies.

enum.label: SUBTRACK / MOVEMENT / SCENE
enum.documentation: Corresponds to parts of a track for audio, such as a movement or scene in a movie.

enum.label: TRACK / SONG / CHAPTER
enum.documentation: The common parts of an album or movie.

enum.label: PART / SESSION
enum.documentation: When an album or episode has different logical parts.

enum.label: ALBUM / OPERA / CONCERT / MOVIE / EPISODE
enum.documentation: The most common grouping level of music and video (e.g., an episode for TV series).

enum.label: EDITION / ISSUE / VOLUME / OPUS / SEASON / SEQUEL
enum.documentation: A list of lower levels grouped together.

enum.label: COLLECTION
enum.documentation: The highest hierarchical level that tags can describe.

element.name: TargetType
element.documentation: An informational string that can be used to display the logical level of the target, such as "ALBUM", "TRACK", "MOVIE", "CHAPTER", etc.

element.name: TagTrackUID
element.documentation: A UID that identifies the `Track(s)` that the tags belong to.
If the value is 0 at this level, the tags apply to all tracks in the `Segment`. If set to any other value, it **MUST** match the `TrackUID` value of a track found in this `Segment`.

element.name: TagEditionUID
element.documentation: A UID that identifies the `EditionEntry(s)` that the tags belong to.
If the value is 0 at this level, the tags apply to all editions in the `Segment`. If set to any other value, it **MUST** match the `EditionUID` value of an edition found in this `Segment`.

element.name: TagChapterUID
element.documentation: A UID that identifies the `Chapter(s)` that the tags belong to.
If the value is 0 at this level, the tags apply to all chapters in the `Segment`. If set to any other value, it **MUST** match the `ChapterUID` value of a chapter found in this `Segment`.

element.name: TagAttachmentUID
element.documentation: A UID that identifies the Attachment(s) that the tags belong to.
If the value is 0 at this level, the tags apply to all the attachments in the `Segment`. If set to any other value, it **MUST** match the `FileUID` value of an attachment found in this `Segment`.

element.name: SimpleTag
element.documentation: Contains general information about the target.

element.name: TagName
element.documentation: The name of the tag value that is going to be stored.

element.name: TagLanguage
element.documentation: Specifies the language of the specified tag in the Matroska languages form; see (#language-codes) on language codes. This element **MUST** be ignored if the `TagLanguageBCP47` element is used within the same `SimpleTag` element.

element.name: TagLanguageBCP47
element.documentation: The language used in the `TagString`, in the form defined in [@!RFC5646]; see (#language-codes) on language codes. If this element is used, then any `TagLanguage` elements used in the same `SimpleTag` **MUST** be ignored.

element.name: TagDefault
element.documentation: A boolean value to indicate if this is the default/original language to use for the given tag.

element.name: TagDefaultBogus
element.documentation: A variant of the `TagDefault` element with a bogus element ID; see (#tagdefault-element).

element.name: TagString
element.documentation: The tag value.

element.name: TagBinary
element.documentation: The tag value if it is binary. Note that this cannot be used in the same `SimpleTag` as `TagString`.
